title: Study — JavaScript + Mathematics — 2025-09-04
brief: Today we’ll warm up on arrays, loops, algebra. Read the brief, then do the 2-minute task.

exercise.title: Two-minute arrays task
exercise.instructions: Write a JavaScript function `sum` that returns the sum of all numbers in an array. If the array is empty, return 0.

acceptance.prompt: Provide a working JS solution for the sum(arr) task.

auto.feedback: Almost correct! Instead of using if (total === 0), you can use return total === 0. Also, the function should work correctly when the input array is empty. Try rewriting it as follows: function sum(arr) { let total = arr.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0); return total; }
